title: Sun-Dried Tomato Oil Crystallization

items.name: Cause of yellowish clumps
items.details: The yellowish-orange clumps on refrigerated sun-dried tomatoes are solidified olive oil or vegetable oil, not mold. This happens when the jar is stored in a cold environment.

items.name: Safety check - smell
items.details: If it still smells tomatoey and savory (not sour, rancid, or musty), it is likely safe.

items.name: Safety check - appearance
items.details: Tomatoes should still be red and flexible or slightly chewy. If you see white fuzz, gray mold, or a sour smell, toss the jar.

items.name: Fix - room temperature
items.details: Leave the jar at room temperature for 15-30 minutes and the oil will liquefy again.

items.name: Fix - warm water bath
items.details: To speed up the process, place the jar in a bowl of warm water for 5-10 minutes.

notes: This is a common concern but almost always harmless. Cold oil solidification is normal and does not indicate spoilage. Only discard if there is white fuzz, gray mold, or a sour/rancid smell.
